data.event: In 1964, a bill was presented to the Philippine Congress to rename the town San Andres in honor of its patron, Saint Andrew the Apostle.

event.title: was approved as Republic Act No. 3948 on June 18

data.event: This bill was approved as Republic Act No. 3948 on June 18 that same year.

event.title: 1989, according to the Catholic Directory of the Philippines published

data.event: In 1989, according to the Catholic Directory of the Philippines published by the Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP), the town of San Andres had a total population of 18,369, the majority of which were Roman Catholic.
